name: Keep My Notes Backup File
summary: Learn about .KMNB files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Keep My Notes is a free app Android users can use to jot down notes, create checklists, and save voice memos. If a user wants to back up the notes they've written in Keep My Notes, they can do so by selecting the app's sandwich menu and then selecting the Backup button. Keep My Notes will then save a copy of the user's notes as a KMNB file.
If a user wants to transfer their notes to another Android device, they can do so by transferring their KMNB file to that device's SD card and then using Keep My Notes' Restore option.
NOTE: Keep My Notes previously saved users' backup files as .MYNOTESBACKUP files.

instructions: You can use a KMNB file to restore your notes in Keep My Notes (Android). To do so:
Transfer your KMNB file to the device on which you want to restore your notes.
Open Keep My Notes, select the sandwich menu, and then select the Restore button.
Navigate to and open your KMNB file.
